Posts.Content: I have only been on Tamoxifen since July 2007.  I have a history or low blood pressure and this has not changed.  I experience hot flashes. The hot flashes were numerous for the first 4 months.  Then they diminished some.  It seems as of this past month, they have increased slightly.   I lost 12 pounds at the onset of diagnosis through Radiation Therapy and have not gained any weight back.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen side effects

Posts.Content: Radiation for me (post rad tx 2 months) were totally uneventful.  My schedule was quite hectic and I truly never really experienced any fatigue that slowed me down.  Each morning (7 AM) I would stop and see a relative at a hospital, the go to work, walk quite a distance to tx, come back to work and work the complete day, go back to the hospital to see the relative, stay until 8 PM, do laundry when I got home.  DId this for 30 treatments and honestly never felt fatigued.  Hopefully your experience will be similar!
Posts.Title: post surgery lumpectomy pre radiation

Posts.Content: On 8/2/2007 Rennie wrote: Thanks, I had RT treatment #6 today, I used Vit E cream 2x/day and wear camisoles as well. I'll have 37 tx, I started to stretch my pect. and lat muscles, I can tell they are tightening. How does your breast look? Is it discolored or spotted, does your nipple still respond to touch?  Today I asked the Dr. if radiation keeps working even after the beam stops and his reply was yes, it works up to 3 months killing the dna of the CA cells so they don't replicate, That's a good thing! ! Thanks Rennie   Rennie sorry it took so long to respond back...I didn't see your e-mail.  I am 6 weeks post Rad Tx.  I still have nothing out of the ordinary to report....the "tan" is still visable but has lightened quite a bit.  Yes the nipple still responds to touch....maybe even more so than before.  I haven't noticed any shrinkage in either breast.  I do notice sometimes a tingle/maybe like mild burn sensation in the treated breast but again, no real problems.  Hope this helps...Sandy
Posts.Title: Radiation therapy

Posts.Content: On 7/28/2007 Rennie wrote: Hi all, I was dx breast CA (Invasive ductal carcinoma)Oct 06 er/pr/her -, Had a Lumpectomy w/ sentinel node just finished being on a clinical trial adriamycin IV x12 w/ GCSF Support X12 weeks and Abraxane IV x12 (I only made it 11 weeks due to peripherial neuropathy and severe muscle weakness and 12 lbs of water weight, edema that I socked away with each treatment)  , I just started on Radiation. Does anyone have any suggestions. I haven't got much info on helping me cope with this. I think I'm more scared of the rad tx. compared to the chemo. I'm a RN and have treated pts w/ radiation burns and the damage is terrible. I have an appointment w/ a nutritonist upcoming, but I've found cancer survivors are the best teachers. Please help. Reny! I just completed 30 treatments (25 regular and 5 boosts)and had no problems.  I am not sure if I am the norm or the exception.  I was told from the beginning to use Aquafor cream (made by Eucertin).  This is an over the counter cream.  I was instructed  to be faithful and use it 4x/day.   Unfortunately because the consistency is like vaseline and I did not like it on my clothes, I used it maximum twice a day.  I did not wear a bra (bought cheap camisoles as instructed) since I had to work every day.  I was told I would feel tired half way through and I can't really say I was.  Other than some itching once in awhile, I had no other problems.   While you are receiving the treatment, you feel absolutely nothing.  I hope I helped answer your question.
